title: Transfer news: The latest rumours from Man Utd, Chelsea, Arsenal and all the top teams
text:
0 Feb 5, 2017 02:03:00 Goal summarises the biggest transfer talk from the Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, the Bundesliga and beyond CHELSEA JOIN AGUERO RACE 
Chelsea have joined Real Madrid in the race for Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero, according to the Sunday Mirror . 
The Argentine could decide to leave the Etihad Stadium this summer as a result of Gabriel Jesus' arrival and is rated at £75 million. MORATA EXPECTS CHELSEA MOVE 
Real Madrid striker Alvaro Morata has told friends he expects to join Chelsea this summer, according to the Daily Telegraph . 
Antonio Conte wants the Spaniard to replace Diego Costa, who remains a target of Atletico Madrid and could leave Stamford Bridge at the end of the season. MAN UTD HAVE DE VRIJ AGREEMENT 
Manchester United look set to beat Chelsea to the signing of Stefan De Vrij after they found a verbal €35 million agreement with Lazio, writes Il Messaggero . 
The Netherlands defender has been tracked by Jose Mourinho on the back of his impressive performances for Lazio this term, and Chelsea will need to pip their Old Trafford rivals' offer if they are to stand any chance of securing his signature. RAKITIC BEGINS RENEWAL TALK 
Barcelona have made significant steps to tying Ivan Rakitic down to a new deal until 2022 after meeting his agent on Friday, claims Marca . 
The Croatian's future has come under scrutiny of late after he was dropped by Luis Enrique, but the trainer has insisted that he remains a key part of the Catalans' plans and urged the club to extend his stay at Camp Nou. SPURS MADE MAHREZ INQUIRY 
Tottenham made an inquiry as to the availabilty of Leicester City winger during the January transfer window, according to The Times . 
Mauricio Pochettino was keen to bring the Algeria international to White Hart Lane, but Spurs were told the player was not for sale at any price so did not make a bid. MAN UTD TO MAKE ROOM FOR GRIEZMANN 
Wayne Rooney and Anthony Martial are two of the players Manchester United are willing to sacrifice in order to bring Antoine Griezmann into the club, according to The Independent . 
United have made Griezmann their top transfer target for the summer , but the newspaper reports the club will have to free up finances after a spell of paying large sums in transfer fees and player wages. And it is Rooney and Martial are the main players who are set to be culled, with Marouane Fellaini, Bastian Schweinsteiger and Ashley Young also on the way out. MILAN COULD MAKE BRAVO BID 
AC Milan have identified Claudio Bravo as their main option to replace Gianluigi Donnarumma should the goalkeeper leave the San Siro this summer, Sport Mediaset reports. 
Bravo has come under scrutiny at Manchester City for his poor displays after replacing the ousted Joe Hart as the first-choice keeper. While Milan have no plans to sell 17-year-old star Donnarumma, with his first professional contract yet to be agreed, they have concerns his agent, Mino Raiola, could take him elsewhere, prompting them to look at other options. CARVALHO FUELS MAN CITY RUMOURS 
William Carvalho's decision to switch to a new football agent has fueled rumours of a possible transfer to Manchester City, according to AS . 
The Portugal midfielder is now represented by Media Base Sports, which is run by Pere Guardiola, the brother of City boss Pep. 
Carvalho has also been linked with Real Madrid, but could be set for a move to the Premier League as Man City look to strengthen their midfield. MADRID TO REJECT BARCA'S SHOCK ISCO MOVE 
Barcelona are weighing up a shock move for Isco but Real Madrid are unlikely to sell to their Clasico rivals, writes Marca . 
Isco is seen as a potential heir to Andres Iniesta at the heart of Barcelona's midfield and his contract that is due to expire in 2018 makes him a potential target. 
However, reports indicate that Madrid are almost certain to turn down a Barcelona bid, meaning the Catalans will have to convince Isco to let his contract run down with the Bernabeu outfit only likely to begin extension talks next season. LIVERPOOL EYE INTER GOALKEEPER 
Liverpool are interested in signing Inter shot-stopper Samir Handanovic as Jurgen Klopp looks to resolve the Reds' goalkeeping issues, according to Corriere dello Sport via TalkSport . 
Both Simon Mignolet and summer-signing Loris Karius have endured tough spells between the sticks at Anfield this season. 
And Liverpool boss Klopp sees Slovenian Handanovic as a potential replacement ahead of next season. BARCA OPEN OZIL TALKS 
Barcelona have joined the list of potential suitors for Arsenal's Mesut Ozil should the Germany international fail to reach an agreement over a contract extension at the Emirates, Sport reports. 
It is alleged that sources within the Catalan club say the playmaker would be happy to return to Spain, though Gunners insiders claim the opposite, stating that the club are confident of reaching an accord over wages. BAYERN PLAN SUMMER BID FOR DELE ALLI 
Bayern Munich are planning a summer bid for Tottenham ace Dele Alli although they are aware they face a tough task prising him away from Spurs, according to the Times The German giants have been tracking the England international for some time and are aware they will have to pay at least £85m if they are to land the 20-year-old. ARDA TURAN IN €100M OFFER FROM CHINA 
Arda Turan is ready to discuss a mega-money move to the Chinese Super League, according to beIN Sports Turkey . 
The Barcelona midfielder has apparently been offered €100 million over a four-year contract and will send his representative to discuss the deal in the coming days. MANCINI READY TO REPLACE BILIC AT WEST HAM 
Roberto Mancini is waiting in the wings to take over at West Ham if Slaven Bilic fails to turn things around, reports the Daily Mirror . 
The Hammers suffered a 4-0 thumping at the hands of Manchester City on Wednesday and Mancini, who watched that game at the London Stadium, is apparently keen to take over. REAL MADRID SET FOR AGUERO SWOOP 
Real Madrid are lining up a serious approach for unsettled Manchester City star Sergio Aguero, according to the Mirror . 
The Argentine has struggled to adapt to life under Pep Guardiola and now faces further competition from Gabriel Jesus up front. And with both Karim Benzema and Alvaro Morata possibly leaving in the summer, Madrid see Aguero as a fine addition to their star-studded forward line in 2017-18. Related
